translated: Connected Discourses With Verses
With Nuns
With Āḷavikā
Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Atha kho āḷavikā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho āḷavikā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the nun Āḷavikā robed up, took her bowl and robe, and entered Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami vivekatthinī.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantā yena andhavanam tena upasaṅkami vivekatthinī
translated: When she had wandered for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from her alms round, after her meal she went to the Blind Men’s Grove to dwell for the day.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā āḷavikāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo🔽vivekamhā cāvetukāmo yena āḷavikā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āḷavikaṁ
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā āḷavikāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ  vivekamhā ca avetu kāmaḥ yena āḷavikā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā āḷavika
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, desiring to arouse fear, trepidation, and terror in the nun Āḷavikā,
and desiring to make her fall away from concentration, approached her and addressed her with this verse:
“There’s no escape from the world;
what will you do with solitude?
Enjoy sensual pleasures;
don’t later regret it.”

analyzed: atha kho āḷavikāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the nun Āḷavikā:

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Who is reciting this verse, a human or a non-human?”

analyzed: atha kho āḷavikāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to her:

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo vivekamhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ vivekamhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is the Evil One, wanting to terrify me, wanting to make me afraid, wanting to make my hair stand on end, wanting to make me fall away from concentration, that is reciting this verse.”

original: Atha kho āḷavikā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho āḷavikā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: Then the nun Āḷavikā, “This is the Evil One,” having understood, replied to the Evil One in verse:
“There is an escape from the world,

analyzed: paññāya me suphussita  pamatta bandhu pāpima
translated: well-probed by me with discernment;
You don’t know that state, O Evil One,🔽you who are a friend of the heedless.
Sensual pleasures are like a sword & stake:
the aggregates are a chopping block.
What you call sensual delight,
that for me is no delight at all.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ āḷavikā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 5.2🔽1. Bhikkhunīvagga🔽Somāsutta🔽Sāvatthinidānaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam āḷavikā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti 🔽sayutta nikāya 🔽bhikkhunī vagga 🔽somāsutta 🔽sāvatthi nidāna
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The nun Āḷavikā knows me,” pained & dejected, vanished right there.

original: Atha kho somā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho somā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Soon afterwards, after robing up in the morning, Somā took her bowl and robe and entered Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantā yena andhavanam tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: When she had walked for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from her alms round, eaten her meal, and given up her meditation session for the day, she went to the Blind Men’s Grove to spend the day.

original: Andhavanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: andhavanam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: After entering the Blind Men’s Grove, she sat down at the root of a tree for the day’s meditation.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā somāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā somāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ
translated: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to make her fearful, wanting to make her tremble, wanting to make her hair stand on end,

original: samādhimhā cāvetukāmo yena somā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā somaṁ bhikkhuniṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:
analyzed: samādhimhā ca avetu kāmaḥ yena somā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā somam bhikkhunim gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
translated: and wanting to drive her out of concentration, went up to her and addressed her with this verse:
“The state that’s to be attained by seers,

analyzed: ṭhānam durabhisambhava  na tam dvi aṅgula paññāya
translated: that’s hard to reach,🔽can’t be reached by a woman
with a two-finger wisdom.”

analyzed: atha kho somāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then Somā thought,

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Who is this, a human or a non-human, that is speaking this verse?”

analyzed: atha kho somāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then she thought,

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo samādhimhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is Mara the Evil One, who wants to make me afraid, unsettle me, make my hair stand on end, and make me fall away from concentration.”

original: Atha kho somā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho somā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: Then the nun Somā, knowing that “This is Mara the Evil One,” replied to him in verses:
“What can it mean to be a woman
when the mind is well concentrated,
when knowledge is present

original: sammā dhammaṁ vipassato.🔽Yassa nūna siyā evaṁ,
analyzed: sammā dhammam vipassato  yassa nūna siyā eva
translated: and one sees the Dhamma rightly?🔽If anyone should say,
‘I am a woman or a man,
or something else,’
that would be Mara speaking.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ somā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam somā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: ” Then Mara the Evil One, realizing, “The nun Somā knows me,” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 51.17
. The Group on Nuns
With Kisāgotamī
At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho kisāgotamī bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho kisāgotamī bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, the nun Kisāgotamī put on her robes and, carrying her bowl and outer robe, went into Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami, upasaṅkamitvā divāvihārāya.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantā yena andhavanam tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā divāvihārāya
translated: After the meal, on returning from alms round, he went to the Blind Men’s Grove for the day’s abiding.

analyzed: andhavanam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: After entering the Blind Men’s Grove, he sat down at the root of a tree for the day’s abiding.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā kisāgotamiyā bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo🔽samādhimhā cāvetukāmo yena kisāgotamī bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā kisāgotamiṁ
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā kisāgotamiyā bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ  samādhimhā ca avetu kāmo yena kisāgotamī bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā kisāgotami
translated: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to give rise to fear, terror, and horripilation in the nun Kisāgotamī,

original: bhikkhuniṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:🔽“Kiṁ nu tvaṁ mataputtāva,
analyzed: bhikkhunim gāthāya ajjhabhāsi  kim nu tvam
translated: and wanting to drive her out of concentration, went to her and, on arrival, addressed her with this verse:🔽“Why are you alone,
like one who’s lost her child, weeping with a tearful face?
Alone in the middle of the forest,
are you looking for a man?”

analyzed: atha kho kisāgotamiyāḥ bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to the nun Kisāgotamī,

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Now who is this, a human or a non-human, that speaks this verse?”

analyzed: atha kho kisāgotamiyāḥ bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to the nun Kisāgotamī,🔽“This is Māra the Wicked, wanting to unsettle me.

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo samādhimhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is the Evil One testing me, wanting to make me afraid, unsettle me, and drive me from my serenity,”

original: Atha kho kisāgotamī bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:🔽“Accantaṁ mataputtāmhi,
analyzed: atha kho kisāgotamī bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi  accantam mataputtāmhi
translated: and she replied to him in verses:
“I’ve lost my children completely,🔽and my husband is no more.
I don’t grieve or weep,
and I’m not afraid of you, sir.
Everywhere my delight is destroyed,
and the mass of darkness is shattered.
Having defeated the army of Death,
I live without defilements.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ kisāgotamī bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 5.4🔽1. Bhikkhunīvagga🔽Vijayāsutta🔽Sāvatthinidānaṁ.🔽Atha kho vijayā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…🔽aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam kisāgotamī bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti 🔽sayutta nikāya 🔽bhikkhunī vagga 🔽vijayāsutta 🔽sāvatthi nidāna 🔽atha kho vijayā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā pe 🔽aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Then Māra, realizing, “The nun Kisāgotamī knows me,” sad and disappointed, disappeared right there.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā vijayāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo🔽samādhimhā cāvetukāmo yena vijayā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā vijayaṁ
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā vijayāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ  samādhimhā ca avetu kāmo yena vijayā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā vijaya
translated: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to give rise to fear, terror, and horror in the nun Vijaya,🔽and wanting to drive her out of concentration, approached her.
Then, when he was close by, he addressed the nun Vijaya in verse:
“You’re young and beautiful,
and I’m young and handsome.
With the five-part music,
let’s enjoy ourselves here.”

analyzed: atha kho vijayāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to the nun Vijaya,

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Who is this, a human or a non-human, that recites this verse?”

analyzed: atha kho vijayāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to her,

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo samādhimhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is Māra the Wicked, wanting to give rise to fear, terror, and horror in me, wanting to drive me out of concentration, that recites this verse.”🔽Then the nun Vijaya, “This is Māra the Wicked,”

original: Atha kho vijayā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho vijayā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: rebuked him with this verse:
“Forms, sounds, smells, tastes,
and touches that are so delightful,
I give you back, Māra,
I have no use for you.
With this putrid body,
Breaking up, decaying,
I am disgusted, ashamed,
Craving for sensual pleasures is destroyed.
Whatever beings have gone to form,
And those who abide in formlessness,
And the attainment of peace,
Everywhere darkness is destroyed.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ vijayā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam vijayā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The nun Vijayā knows me,” pained and depressed, vanished right there.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 47.1
. The Group on Nuns
With Uppalavaṇṇā
At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…🔽aññatarasmiṁ supupphitasālarukkhamūle aṭṭhāsi.
analyzed: atha kho uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā pe  aññatarasmim su pupphita sāla rukkha mūle aṭṭhāsi
translated: Then, in the morning, the nun Uppalavaṇṇā put on her robes and, carrying her bowl and outer robe, went into Sāvatthī for alms.🔽She wandered for alms in Sāvatthī. After the meal, on her return from her alms round, she went to a certain park for the day’s abiding.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo🔽samādhimhā cāvetukāmo yena uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā uppalavaṇṇaṁ
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ  samādhimhā ca avetu kāmaḥ yena uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā uppalavaṇṇa
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, desiring to give rise to fear, terror, and horripilation in the nun Uppalavaṇṇā,
desiring to drive her out of concentration, went up to her and addressed her in verse:
“Having gone to the top of the mountain, bhikkhunī,
You stand alone at the foot of the Sāl tree.

analyzed: na ca atthi te dutiyā vaṇṇa dhātu
translated: There is no second person with you,
Fool, are you not afraid of the one who roams alone?”

analyzed: atha kho uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā:

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Who is this human or non-human that is reciting this verse?”

analyzed: atha kho uppalavaṇṇāya bhikkhuniyā etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā:

analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is the Wicked Māra desiring to give rise to fear, terror, and horror, desiring to drive me out of concentration, that is reciting this verse.”

original: Atha kho uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: Then the bhikkhunī Uppalavaṇṇā, having understood, “This is the Wicked Māra,” replied to Māra the Wicked One with these verses:
“Even a hundred thousand of those who roam alone,
Having come here, would be just like this.
I do not tremble, I am not afraid,

analyzed: na bhāyāmi tam ekikā api  esā antaradhāyāmi
translated: I am not terrified, Māra, even though I am alone.🔽I will disappear,🔽or enter your belly;

analyzed: kucchim vā pavisāmi te 🔽pakhum antarikā ayampi
translated: Or I will go

analyzed: tiṭṭhantim mama na dakkhasi  cittasmin vasībhūtā amhi
translated: You won’t see me standing here.🔽I’ve mastered my mind,
and I’ve well developed the powers.
I’m free from all bonds.
I’m not afraid of you, Sir.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam uppalavaṇṇā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: Then Māra thought, “The nun Uppalavaṇṇā knows me!” and sad and disappointed, he disappeared right there.
Saṃyutta Nikāya 51.17
. The Group on Nuns
With Cāla
At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho cālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…🔽aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho cālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā pe  aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Then, after robing up in the morning, the nun Cālā took her bowl and robe and entered Sāvatthī for alms.🔽After her meal, on her return from alms round, she went to a certain tree, sat down at the foot of it for the day’s meditation, and entered the rain-restraint.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena cālā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā cālaṁ bhikkhuniṁ etadavoca:🔽“kiṁ nu tvaṁ, bhikkhuni, na rocesī”ti?
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā yena cālā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā cālam bhikkhunim etat avoca  kim nu tva bhikkhuni na rocesi iti
translated: Then Māra the Evil One went up to the nun Cālā and said to her, “Nun, why don’t you like it?”

analyzed: jātim khvā āha āvusaḥ na rocemi iti
translated: “I don’t like birth, friend.”
“Why don’t you like birth?
One who’s born enjoys sensual pleasures.
Who has advised you thus:

original: jātiṁ mā roca bhikkhunī”ti.🔽“Jātassa maraṇaṁ hoti,
analyzed: jātim mā roca bhikkhuni iti  jātassa maraṇam hoti
translated: ‘Don’t like birth, O nun’?🔽One who’s born has death.
One who’s born experiences suffering.
“Bondage, killing, and affliction,
therefore I do not delight in birth.
The Buddha taught the Dhamma
to go beyond birth.
For the sake of abandoning all suffering,
he established me in the truth.

original: Ye ca rūpūpagā sattā,🔽ye ca arūpaṭṭhāyino;
analyzed: ye ca rūpa upagā sattā  ye ca arūpa ṭṭhāyino
translated: Those beings who have gone to form,🔽and those who abide in the formless,
not knowing cessation,
will return to renewed existence.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ cālā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam cālā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: Then Māra thought, “The nun Cālā knows me!” and sad and depressed he disappeared right there.
Saṁyutta Nikāya 55.10
. The Group on Nuns
With Upacālā
At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho upacālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…🔽aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho upacālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā pe  aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Then, in the morning, the nun Upacālā dressed and, taking bowl and robe, entered Sāvatthī for alms.🔽After her meal, on her return from alms round, she went to a certain tree, sat down at the foot of the tree for the day’s abiding,

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena upacālā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā upacālaṁ bhikkhuniṁ etadavoca:🔽“kattha nu tvaṁ, bhikkhuni, uppajjitukāmā”ti?
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā yena upacālā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā upacālam bhikkhunim etat avoca  kattha nu tva bhikkhuni uppajjitu kāmā ti
translated: Then Māra the Evil One went up to the nun Upacālā and said to her, “Where do you want to be reborn, nun?”🔽“Friend, I don’t want to be reborn anywhere.”

analyzed: na khvā āha āvuso katthaci uppajjitu kāmā ati
translated: “But, nun, don’t you want to be reborn in the company of the gods of the Thirty-three?”

analyzed: tāvatisā ca yāmā ca  tusitā ca api devatā
translated: “The Thirty-Three Gods and the Yāma Gods,
the Tusita gods and the gods who delight in creating,🔽the gods who control the creations of others,
and the gods of the highest splendor:
Direct your mind there,
and you’ll experience delight.”

analyzed: tāvatisā ca yāmā ca  tusitā ca api devatā
translated: “The Thirty-Three Gods and the Yāma Gods,
the Tusita gods and the gods who delight in creating,🔽the gods who control the creations of others,
and the gods of the highest splendor:
They’re bound by the fetter of sensuality

original: enti māravasaṁ puna.🔽Sabbo ādīpito loko,🔽sabbo loko padhūpito;
analyzed: enti mā aravasam puna  sabbaḥ ādīpito loko  sabbaḥ lokaḥ padhūpito
translated: and return to the domain of Māra.🔽The whole world is ablaze,🔽the whole world is burning,
the whole world is aflame,
the whole world is quaking.
What’s unshaken and not ablaze,
not frequented by ordinary people,
where Māra has no way in:
my mind delights in that.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ upacālā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 5.8🔽1. Bhikkhunīvagga🔽Sīsupacālāsutta🔽Sāvatthinidānaṁ.🔽Atha kho sīsupacālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam upacālā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti 🔽sayutta nikāya 🔽bhikkhunī vagga 🔽sīsupacālāsutta 🔽sāvatthi nidāna 🔽atha kho sīsupacālā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā pe
translated: Then Māra thought, “The nun Upacālā knows me!” and, unhappy and dejected, he vanished right there.
and sat down at the foot of a tree for the day’s meditation.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā yena sīsupacālā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā sīsupacālaṁ bhikkhuniṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā yena sīsupacālā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā sīsupacālam bhikkhunim etat avoca
translated: Then Māra the Wicked went up to the nun Sīsupacālā and said to her,

analyzed: kassa nu tva bhikkhuni pāsaṇḍam rocesi iti
translated: “Nun, who do you approve of?”

analyzed: na khvā āha āvuso kassaci pāsaṇḍam rocemi iti
translated: “I don’t approve of anyone, friend.”
“For whom did you shave your head,
and why do you look like an ascetic?
You don’t approve of any sect,
but you wander around confused.”
“Outside of this teaching,
there are sects that believe in views.
I don’t approve of their teachings,
for they are ignorant of the Teaching.
There is one born in the Sakyan family,
a Buddha without equal.
He has overcome everything, defeated Māra,
and is undefeated in every respect.
He is free in every respect, unattached,
and sees everything with the eye of wisdom.
He has ended all his actions
and is freed in the end of all attachments.
He is my teacher, the Buddha,
and I approve of his teaching.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ sīsupacālā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam sīsupacālā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, realizing, “The nun Sīsupacālā knows me!” sad and disappointed, vanished right there.
Saṃyutta Nikāya 3.1
. The Group on Nuns
With Selā
At Sāvatthī.

original: Atha kho selā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā …pe…🔽aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: atha kho selā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayam nivāsetvā pe  aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: Then, in the morning, the nun Selā put on her robes and, carrying her bowl and outer robe, went into Sāvatthī for alms.🔽After her almsround in Sāvatthī, when she had returned from her almsround, after her meal she went to a certain park for the day’s abiding.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā selāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo …pe…
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā selāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmo pe
translated: Then Māra the Evil One, desiring to give rise to fear, terror, and horripilation in the nun Selā,

original: selaṁ bhikkhuniṁ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi:🔽“Kenidaṁ pakataṁ bimbaṁ,🔽kvanu bimbassa kārako;
analyzed: selam bhikkhunim gāthāya ajjhabhāsi  kenidam pakatam bimba  ku anu bimbassa kārakaḥ
translated: approached her and addressed her in verse:🔽“Who made this painted image?🔽Where’s the maker of the image?
Where did the image originate?
Where does the image cease?”

analyzed: atha kho selāya bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the nun Selā,

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Now who is this—a human or a non-human—that recites this verse?”

analyzed: atha kho selāya bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to her,

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo samādhimhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is Mara the Evil One, who wants to make me afraid, unsettle me, and frighten me, and so make me fall away from concentration.”

original: Atha kho selā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho selā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: Then the nun Selā, knowing that “This is Mara the Evil One,” replied to him in verses:
“This image is not self-made,
nor is this evil other-made.
It arises in dependence on a cause,
and with the cause’s breakup, it ceases.
Just as a seed from which a sprout grows🔽is neither the same as nor different from it,
so too the elements and the aggregates
are neither the same as nor different from each other.

original: Evaṁ khandhā ca dhātuyo,🔽cha ca āyatanā ime;
analyzed: evam khandhā ca  cha ca āyatanā ime
translated: The elements and the aggregates
arise in dependence on a cause,
and with the cause’s breakup, they cease.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ selā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.🔽Saṁyutta Nikāya 5.10🔽1. Bhikkhunīvagga🔽Vajirāsutta🔽Sāvatthinidānaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam selā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti 🔽sayutta nikāya 🔽bhikkhunī vagga 🔽vajirāsutta 🔽sāvatthi nidāna
translated: Then Mara the Evil One, realizing, “The nun Selā knows me,” vanished right there.

original: Atha kho vajirā bhikkhunī pubbaṇhasamayaṁ nivāsetvā pattacīvaramādāya sāvatthiṁ piṇḍāya pāvisi.
analyzed: atha kho vajirā bhikkhunī pubbaṇha samayam nivāsetvā patta cīvaram ādāya sāvatthim piṇḍāya pāvisi
translated: Then, in the morning, she robed up, took her bowl and robe, and entered Sāvatthī for alms.

original: Sāvatthiyaṁ piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantā yena andhavanaṁ tenupasaṅkami divāvihārāya.
analyzed: sāvatthiyam piṇḍāya caritvā pacchābhattam piṇḍapāta paṭikkantā yena andhavanam tena upasaṅkami divāvihārāya
translated: When she had walked for alms in Sāvatthī and had returned from her alms round, after her meal she went to the Blind Men’s Grove for the day’s abiding.

original: Andhavanaṁ ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmiṁ rukkhamūle divāvihāraṁ nisīdi.
analyzed: andhavanam ajjhogāhetvā aññatarasmim rukkha mūle divāvihāram nisīdi
translated: After entering the Blind Men’s Grove, she sat down at the root of a tree for the day’s abiding.

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā vajirāya bhikkhuniyā bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo🔽samādhimhā cāvetukāmo yena vajirā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā vajiraṁ
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā vajirāya bhikkhuniyā bhayam chambhita ttam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ  samādhimhā ca avetu kāmaḥ yena vajirā bhikkhunī tena upasaṅkami upasaṅkamitvā vajira
translated: Then Māra the Wicked, wanting to give rise to fear, terror, and horripilation in the nun Vajirā,🔽and wanting to drive her out of concentration, approached her.

analyzed: bhikkhunim gāthāya ajjhabhāsi  kena ayam pakataḥ satto
translated: Then Māra the Wicked addressed the nun Vajirā with this verse:🔽“By whom was this being made?
Who is the maker of the being?
How did the being come into existence?
How does the being cease?”

analyzed: atha kho vajirāya bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then it occurred to the nun Vajirā,

original: “ko nu khvāyaṁ manusso vā amanusso vā gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khvā ayam manussaḥ vā amanussaḥ vā gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “Who is this—a human or a non-human—that addresses me with a verse?”

analyzed: atha kho vajirāya bhikkhuniyāḥ etat ahosi
translated: Then the thought occurred to her,

original: “māro kho ayaṁ pāpimā mama bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁsaṁ uppādetukāmo samādhimhā cāvetukāmo gāthaṁ bhāsatī”ti.
analyzed: māraḥ kho ayam pāpimā mama bhayam loma hasam uppādetu kāmaḥ samādhimhā ca āvetu kāmaḥ gātham bhāsati iti
translated: “This is the Devaputta Māra, who wants to make me afraid, wants to make me tremble, wants to make the hairs on my body stand on end, wants to unsettle my mind, wants to make me fall away from concentration.

original: Atha kho vajirā bhikkhunī “māro ayaṁ pāpimā” iti viditvā, māraṁ pāpimantaṁ gāthāhi paccabhāsi:
analyzed: atha kho vajirā bhikkhunī māraḥ ayam pāpimā iti viditvā māram pāpimantam gāthāhi paccabhāsi
translated: Then the nun Vajirā, “This is the Devaputta Māra,” knowing him, responded to Māra, the Evil One, in verse:
“Why do you think, ‘A being’?

analyzed: māra diṭṭhi gatam nu te  suddha saṅkhāra puñjoya
translated: Māra, is it your view🔽This is just a heap of fabrications.
Here, a being is not found.
Just as when the parts are assembled,
The word ‘chariot’ is used,
So when the khandhas are present,
The convention ‘a being’ is used.
Only stress comes into play,
Stress remains, and stress goes away.
Apart from stress, nothing comes into play.
Apart from stress, nothing goes away.”

original: Atha kho māro pāpimā “jānāti maṁ vajirā bhikkhunī”ti dukkhī dummano tatthevantaradhāyīti.🔽Bhikkhunīvaggo paṭhamo.🔽Tassuddānaṁ🔽Āḷavikā ca somā ca,
analyzed: atha kho māraḥ pāpimā jānāti mam vajirā bhikkhunī iti dukkhī dummanaḥ tattha iva antaradhāyi iti 🔽bhikkhunī vaggaḥ paṭhamaḥ 🔽tassa uddāna 🔽āḷavikā ca somā ca
translated: Then Māra, the Evil One, “The nun Vajirā knows me!” sad and disappointed, vanished right there.
Gotamī, Vijaya,
Uppalavaṇṇā, and Cālā,
Upacālā, and Sīsupacālā,
and Selā, Vajirā, and you ten.
The Linked Discourses with Nuns is complete.
